Experience Procurement Professional IBM India Pvt Ltd January 2005  –  June 2011  (6 years 6 months) Description: - Developing procurement skills in the marketing communication and travel management and design/construction industry.  
Responsibilities include carrying out and analysing RFPs, RFQs and RFI, negotiating rates with suppliers, maintaining relationships with both internal and external key stake holders, and managings the Supplier relationship to a level consistent with IBM’s initiatives, addressing stakeholder/travellor issues and executing sourcing strategies as set out by the travel procurement team. The buyer will also needs to implement local, regional and global strategies.  
Key Responsibilities -  
•	Receive and respond to IBM suppliers requests and issues. 
•	Negotiate and address day to day issue with MARCOM / travel suppliers 
•	Provide input into major sourcing projects 
•	Run local sourcing projects, including bids and price analysis 
•	Create and maintain contract and other sourcing files for the MARCOM / travel team. 
•	Assist clients with coordinating MARCOM / travel suppliers for IBM events and meetings, e.g. ensuring hotel rooms booked at the correct rate, etc. 
•	Provide advise to clients on the IBM procurement related policies and practices. 
•	Handle advertisements, and events related purchases related to the ANZ area.
